properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 6:48PM EST until February 11 at 1:30AM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
North Central Lincoln County in central West Virginia...

* Until 130 AM EST Tuesday.

* At 648 PM EST, rain gauge data indicated rainfall from today was
resulting in significant rises along area creeks and streams,
including the Mud River. Flooding is expected to begin shortly
along the Mud River near Hamlin.

* At 630 PM EST, the stage of the Mud River near Hamlin was 9.80
feet. The estimated flood stage is 10 feet. The river is expected
to crest this evening between 10 and 11 feet and then slowly fall
overnight. At stages near 10 feet, low areas along the Mud River
start to flood.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Low and poor drainage areas along and near the Mud River
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
